utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh M A Y A. Oh as in the Mayan Bruins.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh I didn't get your name.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: J E A N N E.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And %um I'm planning to have %uh not only a tour but I'm planning to %um spend my summer in Singapore maybe two nights or two days.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh two days would be one night.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think you mean three days and two nights.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh I think two days and one night.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah maybe you can help me out later if it's going to be one night or two nights.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But %um I've heard so many good things about it but I don't really know anything about Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So maybe you can help me out?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You haven't been to Singapore before then?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: May I ask your age group?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh you can make a good guess.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh I'm %um turning twenty six this year.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh twenty six, that's very young.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um, oh I haven't really thought about that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But maybe me and %um I think I'm bringing a friend.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that makes it two of us, yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can get a twin room, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Twi~ Twin is separate beds and %uh- %uh twin and double is the same.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Is just that whether you have- you want to squeeze-in one big bed or you want to have your own tiny bed.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But not really tiny, but what I mean is single bed.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Some people don't like to sleep with other people because they toss and turn and bash them up in their sleep.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh yes, that's a good point.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, well, %um I'm on a limited budget.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh I actually have a thousand dollars- Singaporean dollars to spend for that trip.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So can I afford a really nice room for me instead?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you are staying just one night, you have a good choices %uh for %uh that one night.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well, I'm not really particular about a five-star hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh I just want the amenities to be there like the- %hm well, what kind of amenities do I need?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh AC, %um I should have my own bathroom, %uh what else?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um a fridge in the room, stuff like that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Not- I don't need the kitchen I think.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I just need %uh not really a big room but not a very %uh how to say not a very small enough for me to walk around but not, you know, bump on the bed or somewhere there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then you have a lot of money left over for only a thousand dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The hotels would all have air conditioning in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh what you want is attached bathroom and you want a fridge.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we also have %uh okay, we have a list here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah but if you can get me a room with a really good view that would be nice.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well, if I look out my window, I don't wanna see another wall or another person's room.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I want not really a spectacular view but %uh a view that's not a brick wall or not a- yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Not a view of the busy cars or buses on the street.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Something that you don't see every day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Are you getting it on your screen?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I'm seeing Gallery hotel right now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see the picture at the top?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And that's part of the Theatres on the Bay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: but on the right side of that picture %uh some of the tall buildings in the business district.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's really a nice view.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And your hotel, look at it on your right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It is a sort of art piece with the different colours.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It doesn't look like a hotel to me.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it's right by the Singapore River.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you like to walk around in the evenings or even early morning, it's a very nice place.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, will that fit my budget?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let's see the facilities that they have.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh yes, I forgot to mention that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You have TV with remote cable.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Tea and coffee making facility, hair dryer.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They even give you your own bathrobe and bedroom slippers.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can get a laptop workstation.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But I don't think you want to work on one day, do you?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, but %um %hm do you have pictures of the rooms in this hotel?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Are there pictures of the rooms in this hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me see if they are pictures of-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, because if I will be staying for only one night, I wanna make that night really comfortable.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, I'm looking for more images here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: From the outside of the building, it looks really nice, yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Looks like a museum or some sort of, yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Or maybe a department store, no?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You actually very near to Chinatown across the river.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Do shopping and you could walk around %uh in the evening.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What is that part of the hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think this is the dining area, the middle picture.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I don't know why they call themselves three-star.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But it's in a good location.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think the view is really nice.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And you said that it will fit my budget okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes and it~ Let me see %uh-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Do you see the room view now?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh that's a pretty nice wall art.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, with that lady there, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well I'm staying for a one night or maybe two nights at the most.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'd like to try out some things of course food would be number one.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And then of course I would like to take pictures of myself all over Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So what would be the best places to visit?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just let me give you the rates first.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Did you ask me for the rate just now?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I forgot about the rates already.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you were asking me about the Mer~ %um about %uh the places around.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Do you see the picture of what looks like a lion there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That is also within walking %uh distance from your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you walk along the river and %uh you will reach it in no time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And behind is a first class hotel, the Fullerton Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there's also a museum nearby.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I'm waiting for the rates to appear right now.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's nice to walk around the river.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because in case you come by yourself, you know, %um these places are within walking distance.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's also the historic area %uh with many colonial buildings from the time when we were under the British.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: bring your camera and take lots of photos.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But from the airport, how do I get to the hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me- Just now the room rates.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well, I'd like to have a feel of-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just have a look at your room rates first.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It say single with breakfast is two two seven.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Twin with breakfast is also two two seven.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: This is for one night, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Gallery- I'll probably take gallery twin or double.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh they are the same rate.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So either one is okay. Alright two three eight is that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So either one is okay. Alright two three eight is that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now, you were asking me about- %uh what was your next question?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh how do I get to the hotel from the airport?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me get to the Mass Rapid Transit.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm thinking %uh the fastest %uh way to get to the hotel or maybe how I can move about the city , you know, without much hassle.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Is it- Without much hassle I would say take-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You take the train which is the fastest.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Any traffic jams, %uh it's not affected by it.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh when I get lost in there 'cause I'm pretty bad with directions.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No, you wouldn't get lost because the signage is very good.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And at the station when you arrive at the airport, you will get a help from the station master or the officer %uh at the station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So let me show you where you are.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is the map of the Southern part of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if you- are you getting the map?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I can see the map.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see on the right-hand side number three in green?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That is where the airport is.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you go down to the basement when you arrive and buy a transit ticket, I'll tell you more about it later.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh first you change some money and then you buy your transit ticket with a card.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh you can use the card, you top it up with money and use the card.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Before you go back you provide time to get a refund on the unused portion.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They just hold back a little bit for the manufacture of the card.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, you travel along the green line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: and you come to the- let me see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You go down to Outram Park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see the purple line?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Where the green hits the purple right at the bottom.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you switch to the North Line and you are at Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you go to the next stop Clarke Quay, that's very near to your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Clarke Quay is where you get off and you have to- you may have to walk across the river.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I've done it just for fun myself.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, well, if you say so.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, I'll take your word for it.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So why didn't the- why do the airport their the terminal or station for the train already.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So and- Yes, there's a train station there in the basement.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can see it branching off, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So what they have done is they have split it so that you have to take it only to Tanah Merah and then you take the Westbound line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You make sure you switch on the Westbound or else you'll end up in another part of town called Pasir Ris.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Is a holiday area, it's near the sea.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So if I get lost, that would be okay too.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh %um. Yes that would be okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but the signs are very clear.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if you ask anybody there, most of them are working at the airport.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They will direct you to the right direction.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So now I know how to ge~ go to the hotel from the airport.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, now, let's go to food.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh I'm not %uh very how do I say this?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm not very %uh much of the- I'm not into trying out vary dishes to me.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I want to eat Singaporean food but not %um- %Hm, well not that really exquisite ones.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I just wanna try the simple dishes for Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you don't want to try like at the market or %um you don't want to- so is your stomach delicate or-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh I'm quite allergic to crustaceans, to shrimps and, yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But seafood, only shrimps and crabs but everything else is okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Shrimps and crabs are quite expensive.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They are not so cheap in Singapore %uh because Singaporeans love it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you go the food courts in the Singapore, you- the good thing is you can actually see what you are eating.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, because they cook right in front of you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And also I want the ambiance to be really nice 'cause I'll be- yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh then I suggest you eat near your hotel, since you don't have much time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I believe that for lunch they were having a fifteen dollar promotion.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I have noticed that all the restaurants were having that promotion, so you could have your choice of Italian, Western, Asian, %uh that's for lunch.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Dinner it's a different story, because that is a nice place to be at.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the dinner prices go up quite a bit.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well for lunch, is that buffet style?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh no, usually it's a set meal.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And they stipulate what you are eating.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %um you are sort of told exactly what you are going to eat, exist.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Something that you might want to try in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but they are %uh not in your location.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But I'm trying to look for a dish.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's okay if I have to travel a little bit, 'cause I want to do some exploration too but maybe not too far 'cause I might get lost.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But a place where in %hm not too crowded 'cause I want to enjoy my meal.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I want a place that serve really good food and then-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's- let me try and get it for you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's called Crystal Jade and it's at Holland.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh Holland %uh is not name after the country, it's named after an architect.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you can take the train and %uh you will %uh end-up at Holland just nearby and you can just walk here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And this place is called Crystal Jade.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They have a chain of restaurants all over.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But Holland has got %uh nice ambiance also so you might want to walk around there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, what about inside the restaurant?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, it's nice, it's simple but it's nice.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's not posh, so it won't break your bank.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But it serves %uh better than average Chinese food I think.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh do you know this dish xiao long bao?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah steamed and it's actually got a bit of soup inside the dumpling which is unusual.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I haven't really tried it though.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you see the prices here?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Spending twenty one dollars to thirty dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, a cheap meal at the food centre %uh simple noodles would be only three dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you have two plates, six dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is more expensive than that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And more than the fifteen dollar set meal that you get down by the river where you are.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well, twenty one, yah, maybe %hm- %uh I'm not sure.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But are there other places that I can-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can like grills and %um Kebabs, yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There's a place- There's a place called Race Course Road in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Located where there used to be a real race course in the early days.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there are full of Indian restaurants there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Race Course Road restaurants in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So here we have a list of them.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is that far from the hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh on the Northeast Line, %uh there's a stop right at Little India.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So, when you get off the train station, you just walk.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we have the Chinatown and then this one is Little India.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And these are the major restaurants there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Banana Leaf, I go there myself.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um Banana Leaf means you actually eat off a clean banana leaf.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's- %hm I'm not sure if I wanna eat in a- on a banana leaf.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's also hot, if you like hot food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But you see here they have North Indian and they have South Indian.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you don't go for too much hot food, you can go for the North Indian.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: South Indian food cuisine is quite hot.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the North Indian is milder.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Is got spices but it is not so burning on the tongue.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And we have something called fish head curry.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Curry, yah, I've heard of curry.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They got- They get the head of a big fish and they cook curry with %uh tomato and lady's fingers and a little bit of tamarind, so it's slightly sourish.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it's the favourite of the locals here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: We'll %uh I'm into desserts and sweets too.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I've heard of %uh Chewy Junior 'cause we have that here already.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And I heard from some of my friends that you also have it in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Chewy, what do you call it?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Ch~ Chewy Junior, let me see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I think there are cream puffs.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no but we have similar things.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There, do you see Junior- but I got it here Junior Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, the fi~ I think that's the first one.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now I'm learning something from you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh it's also on the train.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah the Bugis is %uh one of the stops of on the East-West Line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Say vanilla cream, cream puffs, doughnuts.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, and it's- so you could also shop there if you want that whole area-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What can I buy there at that area?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh there is a lane there that you can shop.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's in this Bugis area right across the road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can see there's a small lane and they have lots of little stalls on either side.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um is that like a flea market of some sort?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh if you could- yah I guess you could call it a flea market.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: A bit more organised than a flea market.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Where is it again to, Jeanne?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's right on the train station?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And- The train station is called Bugis.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Bugis is the name of the %uh one of the peoples from Indonesia that came over and settle there %uh two hundred years ago.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh and then it's- the train station is named after them, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, but they are no longer, you know?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They've inherit- they've inter-married with the local Malays and they have- the people have- the Malays have merely moved out to the Eastern side.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is like a major shopping area, there are offices there as well.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I've heard that, yes, there %um like accessories and clothes and shoes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh as you've known %uh I'm on a tight budget, so I have like %uh a really I'm spending three hundred dollars for shopping.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: A little bit of accessories and maybe some shoes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you think I can buy things with three hundred dollars?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you can buy lots of things.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: At Bugis there is a big shopping centre %uh it's called BHG.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It stands for Be Here for Good.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because they took over the store from another store that closed.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But the~ nobody knows- I mean not- very few people bother what is about.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you gotta look for BHG and it's at the Bugis station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And like I said across the road where that little alley is, the Bugis lane you can look for lots of funky clothes, you might like them.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you can buy a lot of things there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: If I wanna buy a souvenirs, so that I can bring them home with me.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Where can I get really nice souvenirs?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: and also walk to Chinatown from your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And when you're at Little India, if you go a little bit earlier, for your dinner, you go across the road to Little India Arcade and you can get lots of souvenirs there too.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well so far %Uh I've- I'm seldom where I'm- going to stay the hotel how to get to the hotel from the airport, food and shopping.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But that's not a pretty nice vacation.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I'm thinking of doing some activities, but I have no idea what to do and usually, yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What do you suggest I do?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay I'm put up- find you some %uh I- what are you interested in?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm I like watching- no. Movies, I can do that at home.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But not movies, not a place.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You're talking about a live show?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Well, if you are open-dated about your arrival %uh I would recommend that you go- I put the wrong the spelling.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have a lovely theatre by the river and it's also within walking distance of your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's called the Theatres on the Bay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are two major theatres and smaller studios.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me get it, the ticketing.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there are concerts and there are also %uh shows %um sort of- during the different periods of time like during Chinese New Year, we have more Chinese themed concerts.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: During the Indian festival time they have Indian musicians coming and Indian concerts.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you're talking about show, I'll go to the Theatres on the Bay and see if I can- a calendar.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I like %uh maybe singers or %hm magic shows those kinds of stuff.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's something that you can't see every day or you can't watch every day or something that you can't catch easily on TV or in the Internet, I'm not sure.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do on an evening before maybe- or after you have taken your dinner.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Something that's nice to do before you sleep.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Ther~ Okay, just give me a moment to get back there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I'm trying to get to their programme section.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it depends on the type of show.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If it's an international artist you are watching, then it's expensive.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But if it's %uh something not so- somebody not so well-known or high profile then it's a little bit better.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, well, that's one I can think of right now.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But actually I have no idea of what I want to do when I get there instead %uh aside from eating and having a tour in the city.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because you are staying one day and it is a bit limited.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So  how many days should I stay to have a good %um feel in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think five days is good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh I don't have that much time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, then you go- %Uh we have good shows at Marina Bay Sands that's where one of the casinos is.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I haven't seen any shows in a Casino Theatre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you don't have to gamble there if you are just seeing the show.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But if I'm staying for two days and one night only, what am I supposed to see or where am I supposed to go if I visit Singapore to make my trip complete?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you like heritage then Little India and %uh Chinatown %uh to walk around it's very exciting.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then to try some of the local food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then in evening you might want to %uh go and see the shows what the one show.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well, I'd like- I'd like to take some photos of myself all over the place.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So where are good spots where I can take photos?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: By the river just outside your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes and walk down the river towards the bay where the Merlion is.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Have you heard of the Merlion?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Why is that a symbol of Singapore by the way?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a- It is a symbol for the Singapore Tourism Board originally %uh because a prince that came to Singapore thought he saw an animal and he was wondering what it was.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And someone told him it's a lion.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But we have no lions in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we think he saw perhaps a tiger or a big deer and because we are a %uh, you know, we are an island and we were a fishing village and now we are an international sea port, so we have the Mer for mermaid and for the sea.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then the lion for the what the prince thought he saw.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So  we have the top and the bottom joined together.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, you see- do you see the Singapore River?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So your hotel is nearby here where you see River Valley Road on the top left.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, in that vicinity is your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a very pleasant walk down the river and you can- cross the road and get on to the North side.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You will be passing bars and eating places along the way.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can take lots of photos of yourself.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Right on the edge is the Merlion Park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can get lots of tourists or tour guides to help you take photos there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well, the hotel sounds like it's very nice.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But if I- for example I want to stay at a- like a small house.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: If the hotel sounds really nice, but if I would like to stay in a small house, can I rent one for a day?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um, I am not sure about that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Renting a house for one day %uh, I am not sure.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But you can rent a room in %uh places that's %uh are for expats settling into Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Do you know what I mean?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, my throat got suddenly itchy.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yah, you having a cough, huh?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I- %hm the hotels sounds nice, okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But %hm and it seems like everything is quite within the vicinity, okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I think that's really good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: that would be enough for my trip.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I hope you will think about staying five days and not just one day.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I would love to stay there for five days but, yah, I can't afford that much %uh, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But I don't think you can a rent house for one day.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, I'll bear that in mind.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Ac~ you said if you go to the, you know, when I told you, you take the wrong journey from the airport, there's a holiday %um- there are holiday bungalows that you can rent.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh there are actually for parties for one night.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh usually people rent them to throw a wild party, away from where people live, okay.
